decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the board by utilizing various removal spells and sacrificing creatures to trigger powerful effects. The deck aims to generate value through cards like Trail of Crumbs, Mayhem Devil, and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King. By sacrificing Cauldron Familiar and utilizing Witch's Oven, the deck can create a loop that deals damage to the opponent and gains life. The deck also includes threats like Bonecrusher Giant and Murderous Rider to deal with opposing threats, while using Vraska, Golgari Queen for additional removal and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing a low mana curve to quickly flood the board with evasive creatures, such as Spectral Sailor, Sea-Dasher Octopus, and Brineborn Cutthroat. Counterspells like Quench, Neutralize, and Mystical Dispute help control the opponent's spells while also protecting your own creatures. The inclusion of tempo cards like Brazen Borrower and Aether Gust allow for disruption and versatility in dealing with threats. Castle Vantress provides additional card selection and late-game advantage. Overall, the deck aims to maintain constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan through efficient creature plays and spell interactions.

The deck is focused on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and powerful threats. It aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy. With a mix of versatile spells and powerful creatures like Uro, Dream Trawler, and Agent of Treachery, the deck can adapt to various situations and outvalue the opponent in the long game. The use of Yorion as a companion adds an extra layer of value by blinking permanents for additional card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast multiple spells for free each turn. By utilizing powerful control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, the deck aims to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck features a strong late-game threat in the form of Cavalier of Flame, along with card advantage provided by Sphinx of Foresight and Keruga, the Macrosage. This deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient spell usage and strategic decision-making.

The deck aims to control the game through various counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage with cards like Omen of the Sea and Teferi, Time Raveler. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Narset, Parter of Veils to further control the opponent's resources. The deck's win condition is generating value with Yorion, Sky Nomad blinking all of the deck's powerful ETB effects and overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and tempo.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly getting out Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures from the deck, such as Agent of Treachery. Cards like Raise the Alarm, Charming Prince, and Brazen Borrower help to trigger Winota's ability and generate value. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast also helps to cheat out creatures from the deck. Teferi, Time Raveler provides control and disruption while Fblthp, the Lost provides card draw. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent mana sources to support the aggro strategy.

The deck revolves around utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, allowing the player to maintain control of the board while also generating advantage through powerful card draw and removal effects. The deck also includes a companion, Keruga, the Macrosage, to further enhance card advantage. By leveraging powerful control elements such as counterspells and board wipes, as well as strong threats like Kenrith, the Returned King and Cavalier of Flame, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Deafening Clarion and Shatter the Sky. The goal is to stall the game until the late game where you can play powerful threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King to finish off your opponent. The companion, Keruga, the Macrosage, provides card advantage in a deck full of high-cost cards, ensuring you have the resources to outvalue your opponent in the long run.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes Wilderness Reclamation to generate more mana and activate powerful instant spells like Expansion/Explosion and Shark Typhoon. The deck also includes Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for additional card draw and lifegain. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's plans while building up resources to secure a late-game victory. With a mix of spells to counter threats and generate value, the deck aims to outlast opponents and dominate the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the game with a mix of removal spells, card draw, and planeswalkers. It aims to outvalue the opponent with cards like Shark Typhoon, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Inspired Ultimatum, while also ramping up with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Additionally, the deck includes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for added value and synergies with the abundance of permanents in the deck. Ultimately, the deck seeks to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful cards and interactions.

The deck focuses on maximizing value and card advantage through the use of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to create a 80-card deck. It includes a variety of powerful control cards such as Shark Typhoon, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Teferi, Time Raveler to answer threats and control the game. In addition, it has powerful card draw engines like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to control the board, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and outvalue them in the long game.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to maximize damage output and card draw potential. By utilizing cards that benefit from cycling like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, along with powerful finishers like Zenith Flare, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion enhances the deck's consistency and provides additional value by allowing players to replay cycling cards from the graveyard. Overall, the deck's aggro-cycling strategy aims to pressure opponents early and maintain a steady stream of threats throughout the game.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a flurry of small, evasive creatures and disruptive counterspells. By combining efficient creatures like Brineborn Cutthroat and Brazen Borrower with counter spells like Mystical Dispute and Quench, the deck aims to control the board and push through damage before the opponent can mount a defense. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt to help maintain momentum and ensure a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Castle Vantress provides additional card selection and late-game value.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing a high mana curve in order to control the game through card advantage and board presence. The deck aims to stall the game with counterspells, removal, and board wipes while building up resources through card draw and ramp spells. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by generating incremental advantages over time, eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly cycle through cards in order to build up a large hand size and graveyard for maximum synergy with cards like Zenith Flare. By cycling through cards, the player can trigger abilities and create powerful effects on the board at a rapid pace, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of aggressive plays. The deck focuses on creating a strong cycling engine with cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger, while utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value and recursion options.

The deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, allowing the player to control the board and tempo of the game. It utilizes powerful creatures like Sphinx of Foresight, Legion Warboss, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith, the Returned King to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way provides card draw and additional control options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain dominance on the battlefield.
